function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited access to internet prevents adoption of online supervised exercise in low- and middle-income countries.","Impact":"Reduced ability to improve mental health through exercise in countries with limited access to internet.","Mitigation":"Exploring alternative measures to increase physical exercise without relying on internet resources.","Technologies":"Developing offline or low-tech exercise programs that do not require internet access.","People":"Residents of low- and middle-income countries.","Owner":"Public health organizations and policymakers."},{"Description":"Different types of exercise may have varying stress-buffering effects on mental health, affecting different groups of people under different contexts.","Impact":"Ineffectiveness of exercise interventions for certain groups of people in managing mental health during a pandemic.","Mitigation":"Comparing and studying the stress-buffering effects of different exercise types and alternative stress-modifying interventions.","Technologies":"Research and data analysis to determine the most effective exercise interventions for different groups.","People":"Populations with varying exercise preferences and mental health needs.","Owner":"Research organizations and public health institutions."},{"Description":"Limited access to supervised exercise and mentoring may hinder motivation for physical activity, particularly in times of stress.","Impact":"Reduced motivation and engagement in physical activity, leading to potential negative effects on mental health.","Mitigation":"Studying motivation as a moderating factor for different modes of exercise and evaluating the impact on mental health.","Technologies":"Innovative exercise monitoring and mentoring technologies to encourage motivation and engagement.","People":"Individuals in need of support for physical activity and mental health.","Owner":"Healthcare providers and mental health professionals."}]}
